N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 190.41 - Salt Hill State Forest

State Regulations

In addition to other applicable general provisions of this

Part, the following requirements apply to Salt Hill State Forest. In the event
of a conflict, these specific provisions shall control. (a) Description. For the purposes of this
section, Salt Hill State Forest refers to a portion of the Cortlandt Manor

Patent, located in the New York City Croton Watershed, approximately 32 miles
north of New York City's Central Park, on the north side of Yorktown Road, near

New York City's Croton Reservoir. The property includes one parcel, totaling
269.7 acres in the Town of Cortlandt, in Westchester County, being the same
land as more particularly described in a deed conveying such lands to the

People of the State of New York, on file in the Department of Environmental

Conservation, Albany, NY, and duly recorded in the offices of the county clerks
of Westchester County. (b) All
camping is prohibited within the Salt Hill State Forest. (c) No person shall enter the Salt Hill State

Forest between one-half hour after sunset and one-half hour before sunrise
except for: (1)
licensed anglers for the
purpose of fishing; (2)
licensed
hunters and trappers for the purpose of hunting or trapping; (3)
persons otherwise authorized by permit
issued by the department. (d) No person shall kindle, build, maintain, or use a fire within the Salt Hill State Forest, including, but not limited to, charcoal fires, wood fires, gas grills, propane stoves or other portable
stoves. (e) No person shall possess
alcoholic beverages within the Salt Hill State Forest. (f) No person shall possess glass containers
within the Salt Hill State Forest except, when necessary for the storage of
prescribed medications. (g) No
person shall play a musical instrument or audio device within the Salt Hill

State Forest, including, but not limited to radios, tape players, compact disc, or digital players, unless the noise is rendered inaudible to the public by
personal noise-damping devices such as headphones or earbuds. (h) Bathing and swimming are prohibited
within the Salt Hill State Forest. (i) No person shall park any motor vehicle
within the Salt Hill State Forest, except at areas designated and marked by the
department as parking areas. Notes
